questions.question: What is the primary goal of software maintenance?
answers: 1. To fix existing bugs only
2. To improve system performance and add new features
3. To completely rewrite the system
4. To document the software for new developers

questions.question: Which testing strategy uses graphs to simulate system behavior for test planning?
answers: 1. Control-flow testing
2. Data-flow testing
3. Black box testing
4. White box testing

questions.question: What is a common challenge in software project management?
answers: 1. Over-communication within the team
2. Keeping the project within budget and time constraints
3. Using the most advanced programming languages
4. Finding enough software to copy from

questions.question: What is a prototype?
answers: 1. Initial display of user interface
2. Testing process
3. Name of the last stage in production
4. all answers is uncorrect

questions.question: Which is a key principle of Agile software development?
answers: 1. Comprehensive documentation over working software
2. Following a plan strictly
3. Customer collaboration over contract negotiation
4. Process and tools over individuals and interactions

questions.question: In software engineering, what is 'refactoring' primarily used for?
answers: 1. Adding new features
2. Improving the existing code without changing its functionality
3. Fixing bugs
4. Changing software functionality

questions.question: What does 'scalability' refer to in software engineering?
answers: 1. The ability to add new team members
2. The software's ability to handle increasing amounts of data
3. The size of the software
4. The cost of the software

questions.question: In a software development team, what is the role of a 'Scrum Master'?
answers: 1. To write the most code
2. To manage the project budget
3. To facilitate Agile practices and remove impediments
4. To design the software's user interface

questions.question: What is 'continuous integration' in software development?
answers: 1. Keeping code integrated with customer needs
2. Regularly merging code changes into a shared repository
3. Constant communication with the client
4. Uninterrupted software development

questions.question: Which of the following best describes 'pair programming'?
answers: 1. Two programmers working on different parts of the same project
2. Two programmers working together at one workstation
3. A programming competition between two developers
4. A mentoring session between a senior and junior programmer

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a 'code review'?
answers: 1. To evaluate the coding skills of the programmer
2. To find and fix bugs and improve code quality
3. To determine the salary of the programmer
4. To measure the speed of coding

questions.question: What is 'technical debt'?
answers: 1. The cost of additional resources needed for a project
2. The money paid to software developers
3. The cost of not fixing bugs in a software
4. The future cost incurred due to earlier quick fixes instead of proper solutions

questions.question: What is the purpose of regression testing?
answers: 1. To check for the introduction of new features
2. To ensure that changes do not introduce new faults
3. To test the system's performance under load
4. To validate the user interface

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of black box testing?
answers: 1. Testing based on code coverage
2. Testing based on the functionality without knowing the internal workings
3. Testing that focuses exclusively on the user interface
4. Testing that requires an understanding of the software's algorithms

questions.question: What is a key characteristic of automated tests in software development?
answers: 1. They eliminate the need for manual testing
2. They are only used in white box testing
3. They allow tests to be run repeatedly over time to check for regressions
4. They are less reliable than manual tests

questions.question: What is architectural drift?
answers: 1. A new version of the software architecture
2. The process of updating the system's documentation
3. Introduction of major design decisions that do not align with the guiding architecture
4. The physical movement of the development team to a new location

questions.question: What role do connectors play in software architecture?
answers: 1. They serve as the user interface components
2. They manage the database connections exclusively
3. They regulate interactions between components
4. They represent the software's deployment on hardware devices

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of Model Driven Engineering (MDE)?
answers: 1. It eliminates the need for software testing
2. It allows for consideration of systems at higher levels of abstraction and automatic code generation
3. It focuses exclusively on improving software aesthetics
4. It simplifies the manual coding process without generating code

questions.question: Sequence Diagram:
answers: 1. Shows the sequence of all operations in the system
2. Shows the sequence of interactions between the actors and the objects within a system
3. Shows the sequence of interactions only of the players
4. Show the sequence of interactions only of the objects

questions.question: Model Driven Engineering is (MDE)
answers: 1. is the engineering of all the UML diagrams
2. from this type of Engineering they started to know what models are
3. Is the same as computer science engineering
4. An approach to software development in which the main products of the development process are models

questions.question: Which diagram is a UML diagram?
answers: 1. ERD: Entity Relationship Diagram
2. DFD: Data Flow Diagram
3. Use case
4. All answers are incorrect

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of defining requirements in software development?
answers: 1. To decide the programming language to be used
2. To understand and define what the customer needs
3. To finalize the software design
4. To estimate the cost of the project

questions.question: What are non-functional requirements in a software project?
answers: 1. Requirements that are not essential
2. Requirements related to the system's overall properties like security and performance
3. Requirements that are related to specific functionalities
4. Requirements that change during the project lifecycle

questions.question: What is a key goal of the contract survey?
answers: 1. To select the programming languages to be used
2. To ensure there is a mutual understanding of the documents between client and developers
3. To complete the software development ahead of schedule
4. To reduce the software's feature set

questions.question: Which factor does NOT affect the scope of a contract survey?
answers: 1. The marketing strategy for the software
2. The importance and size of the project
3. The complexity of the project
4. The experience level of the team

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating prototypes in the requirements analysis phase?
answers: 1. To provide a final version of the software
2. To understand user needs and test functionalities
3. To define the software's database structure
4. To decide on the software's coding standards

questions.question: Which of the following best describes functional requirements?
answers: 1. General constraints and performance quality of the system
2. Specific actions or behaviors the system must perform
3. Regulations and ethical considerations external to the system
4. Development environments and programming languages used

questions.question: Why is Agile methodology considered effective in managing changing requirements?
answers: 1. Because it follows a strict plan with no changes allowed
2. Because it emphasizes on comprehensive documentation
3. Because it accommodates changes rapidly and focuses on incremental development
4. Because it completely eliminates the need for requirements

questions.question: What type of maintenance involves adapting the system to new environments?
answers: 1. Corrective maintenance
2. Adaptive maintenance
3. Perfective maintenance
4. Preventive maintenance

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a maintenance programmer?
answers: 1. Must be able to diagnose and repair issues
2. Should only focus on adding new features
3. Requires excellent documentation skills
4. Must ensure changes do not introduce regression faults

questions.question: Why is maintenance programming considered challenging by most programmers?
answers: 1. It involves only simple, repetitive tasks
2. It is seen as less creative than initial development
3. It is often undervalued and poorly compensated
4. Maintenance tasks are straightforward and lack complexity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a focus of a proposal survey?
answers: 1. Clarifying and properly documenting the customer's requirements
2. Estimating the costs, resources, and time required
3. Finalizing the software development tools to be used
4. Identifying risks and settling formal aspects

questions.question: What is a key principle of Agile software development?
answers: 1.Extensive planning at the beginning of a project to ensure there are no changes in the requirements.
2.Strong documentation is more important than working software.
3.Regular adaptation to changing circumstances and user feedback.
4.Complete each project phase before starting the next one without any overlap.

questions.question: Why did the software fail in 2005?
answers: 1. The customers would always press the developers about the time
2. Inaccurate estimates of needed resources
3. Unmanaged risks
4. Answers 2 and 3 are correct

questions.question: Development Testing is:
answers: where the system is tested during development to discover bugs and defects
where a separate testing team test a complete version of the system before it is released to users
where users or potential users of a system test the system in their own environment
4. Answers 1 and 2 are correct

questions.question: Which of these are the activities of the software process
answers: 1. Development
2. Verification
3. evolution
4. All the answers are correct

questions.question: What does a staff development program describe
answers: 1. How to divide the work between the employees
2. Deciding which of the team will work on the project and who will not
3. How to increase the number of employees in the team
4. How will the skills of the project team members be developed

questions.question: : Model Driven Engineering is (MDE)
answers: 1. is the engineering of all the UML diagrams
2. from this type of Engineering they started to know what models are
3. Is the same as computer science engineering
4. An approach to software development in which the main products of the development process is models

questions.question: which diagram is a UML diagram?
answers: 1. ERD : Entity Relationship Diagram
2. DFD: Data Flow Diagram
3. use case
4. all answers is uncorrect

questions.question: What is the role of ethnography in requirement analysis?
answers: 1. To document the software development process
2. To observe and analyze how users actually work
3. To design the user interface of the software
4. To assess the scalability of the software

questions.question: Why are requirements in a software project often considered incomplete or inconsistent?
answers: 1. Because they are not important for the project
2. Because it's impossible to gather all user needs accurately
3. Because they are always changing
4. Because developers do not understand them correctly

questions.question: What does Requirement Traceability refer to in software development?
answers: 1. The ability to track changes in software code
2. The process of documenting the source of each requirement
3. The method of testing software requirements
4. The practice of updating software documentation

questions.question: What are the main types of requirements in software engineering?
answers: 1. Functional and Non-Functional Requirements
2. Technical and Non-Technical Requirements
3. Internal and External Requirements
4. Mandatory and Optional Requirements

questions.question: How are 'user requirements' and 'system requirements' different?
answers: 1. User requirements are about the software interface, while system requirements are about the underlying architecture
2. User requirements are defined by developers, while system requirements are defined by users
3. User requirements are general needs from the customer's perspective, while system requirements are detailed technical specifications
4. There is no difference; they are the same

questions.question: What challenges might arise in collecting and analyzing software requirements?
answers: 1. Stakeholders not understanding their own needs
2. Lack of technical tools for analysis
3. Too many requirements to analyze
4. Developers' reluctance to follow requirements
